Sentencas: The evaluation of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) combined heat and power (CHP) system configurations for application in residential dwellings is explored through modeling and simulation of cell-stacks including the balance-of-plant equipment.
Titulo: Evaluation of system configurations for solid oxide fuel cell-based micro-combined heat and power generators in residential applications

Sentencas: Five different SOFC system designs are evaluated in terms of their energetic performance and suitability for meeting residential thermal-to-electric ratios.
Titulo: Evaluation of system configurations for solid oxide fuel cell-based micro-combined heat and power generators in residential applications

Sentencas: Effective system concepts and key performance parameters are identified.
Titulo: Evaluation of system configurations for solid oxide fuel cell-based micro-combined heat and power generators in residential applications

Sentencas: The SOFC stack performance is based on anode-supported planar geometry.
Titulo: Evaluation of system configurations for solid oxide fuel cell-based micro-combined heat and power generators in residential applications

Sentencas: A cell model is scaled-up to predict voltage-current performance characteristics when served with either hydrogen or methane fuel gas sources.
Titulo: Evaluation of system configurations for solid oxide fuel cell-based micro-combined heat and power generators in residential applications

Sentencas: System comparisons for both fuel types are made in terms of first and second law efficiencies.
Titulo: Evaluation of system configurations for solid oxide fuel cell-based micro-combined heat and power generators in residential applications

Sentencas: The results indicate that maximum efficiency is achieved when cathode and anode gas recirculation is used along with internal reforming of methane.
Titulo: Evaluation of system configurations for solid oxide fuel cell-based micro-combined heat and power generators in residential applications

Sentencas: System electric efficiencies of 40% HHV (45% LHV) and combined heat and power efficiencies of 79% (88% LHV) are described.
Titulo: Evaluation of system configurations for solid oxide fuel cell-based micro-combined heat and power generators in residential applications

Sentencas: The amount of heat loss from small-scale SOFC systems is included in the analyses and can have an adverse impact on CHP efficiency.
Titulo: Evaluation of system configurations for solid oxide fuel cell-based micro-combined heat and power generators in residential applications

Sentencas: Performance comparisons of hydrogen-fueled versus methane-fueled SOFC systems are also given.
Titulo: Evaluation of system configurations for solid oxide fuel cell-based micro-combined heat and power generators in residential applications

Sentencas: The comparisons indicate that hydrogen-based SOFC systems do not offer efficiency performance advantages over methane-fueled SOFC systems.
Titulo: Evaluation of system configurations for solid oxide fuel cell-based micro-combined heat and power generators in residential applications

Sentencas: Sensitivity of this result to fuel cell operating parameter selection demonstrates that the magnitude of the efficiency advantage of methane-fueled SOFC systems over hydrogen-fueled ones can be as high as 6%.
Titulo: Evaluation of system configurations for solid oxide fuel cell-based micro-combined heat and power generators in residential applications
Evaluation of system configurations for solid oxide fuel cell-based micro-combined heat and power generators in residential applications
